alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 2:00PM HST until December 19 at 8:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 500 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 153 PM HST, radar indicated a band of heavy rain moving over West Maui from the west with rain rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. The band will move rapidly eastward across the rest of Maui over the next several hours. - This advisory includes the entire island of Maui. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 500 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. A Flood Watch is also in effect for Maui County through early Tuesday morning.
